lib Package¶

lib Package¶

The lib package is the main library of Python modules for ORMPY.

CommandLine Module¶

This program contains the command line UI for the ORMPY program.

lib.CommandLine.execute()[source]¶

Command line entry point for ORMPY program.

Constraint Module¶

This module provides a class for ORM constraints.

Bases: lib.ModelElement.ModelElement

An ORM Constraint.

class lib.Constraint.SubtypeConstraint(uid=None, name=None)[source]¶

Bases: lib.Constraint.Constraint

A subtype constraint.

preferred_id = None¶

True if subtype constraint is on path to preferred id. This is relevant if the subtype inherits one of its supertypes’ reference schemes, and the supertype graph is not a simple path.

Subtype object type

supertype = None¶

Supertype object type

Model Module¶

Model.py provides a class to store a simplified ORM model consisting of a set of object types, a set of fact types, and a set of constraints.

class lib.Model.Model[source]¶

Bases: object

Simplified representation of an ORM model.

constraints = None¶

The set of constraints in the model (lib.Constraint.ConstraintSet)

display()[source]¶

Prints the model to stdout.

fact_types = None¶

The set of fact types in the model (lib.FactType.FactTypeSet)

object_types = None¶

The set of object types in the model (lib.ObjectType.ObjectTypeSet)

ModelElement Module¶

ModelElement.py provides an abstract class for a model element (a generic element in a model from which an object type, fact type, and constraint can be derived) as well as an abstract class for a set of model elements.

class lib.ModelElement.ModelElement(uid=None, name=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

An abstract element in an ORM model.

name[source]¶

Unique name for the model element. Cannot be changed after the model element is created.

uid[source]¶

Unique identifier for the model element. Cannot be changed after the model element is created.

class lib.ModelElement.ModelElementSet(name='Model Elements')[source]¶

Bases: object

A set of model elements.

add(element)[source]¶

Add an element to the set.

count()[source]¶

Returns the number of items in the set.

display()[source]¶

Display the set of elements to stdout.

get(name)[source]¶

Retrieve an element by name. Returns None if the element is not in the set.

name = None¶

The name of the set. May be used for display, etc.

NormaLoader Module¶

Module for importing .orm files produced by the NORMA modeling tool, which is a plugin for Visual Studio.

NormaLoader.py has been tested on the .orm file format that utilizes the following namespaces:

  • ormRoot: http://schemas.neumont.edu/ORM/2006-04/ORMRoot
  • orm: http://schemas.neumont.edu/ORM/2006-04/ORMCore

NormaLoader intentionally ignores much of the .orm file structure when loading the file into a lib.Model.Model object (much of the .orm file is not relevant to the analyses performed by ORMPY). All information outside of the <orm:ORMModel> node is ignored, which includes things like diagram (shape) data and extensions. NormaLoader also ignores the following (not necessarily exhaustive) list of items:

  • Sample (instance) data
  • Model elements not explicitly modeled by the modeler (implicit elements)
  • Model errors reported by NORMA
  • Informal model notes
  • Multiple readings for a fact type
  • Derivation rules for subtypes, fact types, and roles
  • Constraints outside the scope of ORM– or its extensions

A list of important model elements (such as derivations and constraints) that are ignored by NormaLoader is contained in the omissions attribute after loading the input file.

class lib.NormaLoader.NormaLoader(filename)[source]¶

Bases: object

Loads an .orm file produced by the NORMA modeling tool into a lib.Model.Model. There are no public methods in this class. An .orm file can be loaded via the constructor. For example:

loader = NormaLoader("/path/to/file/example.orm")
model = loader.model
model = None¶

The ORM model (lib.Model.Model) loaded from the .orm file.

omissions = None¶

List of items in the .orm file omitted by the NormaLoader

ObjectType Module¶

ObjectType.py provides classes for the various object types in ORM: entity type, value type, and objectified type.

class lib.ObjectType.EntityType(uid=None, name=None)[source]¶

Bases: lib.ObjectType.ObjectType

An entity type is an object type that requires identification.

identifying_constraint = None¶

Reference to the uniqueness constraint that provides the preferred identification scheme for this entity type.

class lib.ObjectType.ObjectType(uid=None, name=None)[source]¶

Bases: lib.ModelElement.ModelElement

Abstract class inherited by all object types.

implicit = None¶

True for implicit object types

independent = None¶

True for independent object types

class lib.ObjectType.ObjectTypeSet[source]¶

Bases: lib.ModelElement.ModelElementSet

Container for a set of object types.

class lib.ObjectType.ObjectifiedType(uid=None, name=None)[source]¶

Bases: lib.ObjectType.ObjectType

An objectified type is an object type that objectifies a fact type.

identifying_constraint = None¶

Reference to the uniqueness constraint that provides the preferred identification scheme for this object type.

nested_fact_type = None¶

Reference to the fact type that this object type objectifies.

class lib.ObjectType.ValueType(uid=None, name=None)[source]¶

Bases: lib.ObjectType.ObjectType

A value type is a self-identifying object type.

data_type = None¶

Python data type (mapped from the conceptual data type selected by the modeler)

data_type_length = None¶

Length facet for data_type

data_type_scale = None¶

Scale facet for data_type
